oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Civil War bugle
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Brass bugle with castellated suture in bell section that confirms it as original to the 1860s. Dovetailed (zippered) seams are found on all Civil War-era bugles. (See North South Trader's Civil War, Vol. 29, no. 4, 2003, pg. 46, Fig. 14.) All Civil War bugles must have seams that reach all the way down to the opening of the bell.
